body: It seems that `npm` failed to install `node-keytar`, can you remove the `node_modules` folder and run `bootstrap.py` again?
I deleted the node_modules directory and ran bootstrap.py and it resulted in the same error.
Can you paste the content of `npm-debug.log` file?

npm-debug.log isn't being generated.

running npm install results in this:

I can install keytar fine on Win 7 HP x64, Node 0.10.32, npm 1.4.28.
Maybe something wrong with your paths?

Can you install other native modules?

(@brandonecraig just a little tip: when posting console or log output put a line with 3 backticks before and after the output. It's better readable that way.
```
log, blah, yada
```)
Can you give me an example of a different native module?
Try `npm install time` for a small one.

Don't see anything wrong at first glance.

I'm closing this because this is actually a problem of `npm` or `node-gyp`, I suggest looking for help in those projects' pages so you can find a solution more easily.

I also saw some similar issues in node-gyp:
https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-gyp/issues/277
https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-gyp/issues/417
If anyone is curious, I got past this by uninstalling all versions of .NET and reinstalling 4.5.1

I also had this issue. I did the following 
- Reinstalled VS 2012 Express to get the 2012 version of the VC++ build tools
- ran `npm config set msvs_version 2012 --global` as per http://kevgriffin.com/specifying-visual-studio-version-in-npm-installs/

Perhaps an update to the docs?
@jimgraham Have you tried VS 2013 Community Edition?

@zcbenz I have VS 2013 pro already installed (it's my primary IDE) 

I can test this out on a clean VirtualBox install tomorrow if that helps.
I guess it is caused by multiple versions of VS installed, I'll add this to docs, so no need to have another test.  And thanks for finding it out.
